trans-unit.source: Provides a container for a group of commands or controls.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> controls provide an overflow mechanism that places items that do not fit on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> into an overflow area.
Only toolbar elements within a parent <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray> can be moved or resized by the user.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl>, which means its header and collection of objects can be of any type (such as string, image, or panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl> class.
Customizing the ToolBar Control
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>, see [ToolBar Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/toolbar-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates where the toolbar should be located in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.

The position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray> depends on the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Orientation%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A> properties.

When <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Orientation%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Orientation.Horizontal>, a band represents a row in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray>.
When <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Orientation%2A> is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Orientation.Vertical>, a band represents a column of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray>.

The following table describes the relationship between <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Orientation%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A>.
Orientation
Band
BandIndex
Horizontal
Indicates the row in which the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> is positioned.
Toolbars that have <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A> set to a smaller value are above those with a larger value.
Indicates the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A>.
Toolbars that have <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A> set to a smaller value are to the left of those with a larger value.
Vertical
Indicates the column in which the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> is positioned.
Toolbars that have <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A> set to a smaller value are to the left of those with a larger value.
Indicates the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A>.
Toolbars that have <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A> set to a smaller value are above those with a larger value.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The band of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref> in which the toolbar is positioned.
The default is 0.
Gets or sets the band index number that indicates the position of the toolbar on the band.
If you do not explicitly set this property, its value is determined by the order in which the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> is set in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray>.

For example, if you put two toolbars in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray> without setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A> properties, the value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A> will be 0 for both toolbars.
The value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A> will be 0 for the first toolbar and 1 for the second toolbar.

The position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray> depends on the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Orientation%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A> properties.

When <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Orientation%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Orientation.Horizontal>, a band represents a row in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray>.
When <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Orientation%2A> is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Orientation.Vertical>, a band represents a column of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray>.

The following table describes the relationship between <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray.Orientation%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A>.
Orientation
Band
BandIndex
Horizontal
Indicates the row in which the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> is positioned.
Toolbars that have <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A> set to a smaller value are above those with a larger value.
Indicates the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A>.
Toolbars that have <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A> set to a smaller value are to the left of those with a larger value.
Vertical
Indicates the column in which the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> is positioned.
Toolbars that have <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A> set to a smaller value are to the left of those with a larger value.
Indicates the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band%2A>.
Toolbars that have <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex%2A> set to a smaller value are above those with a larger value.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The position of a toolbar on the band of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.BandIndex"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.Band"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> applied to buttons on a toolbar.
Use this property to change the default style of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> controls on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*="`{` **ToolBar.ButtonStyleKey**`}"/>`
A resource key that represents the default style for buttons on the toolbar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> applied to check boxes on a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
Use this property to change the default style of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox> controls on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*="`{` **ToolBar.CheckBoxStyleKey**`}"/>`
A resource key that represents the default style for check boxes on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> applied to combo boxes on a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
Use this property to change the default style of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> controls on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*="`{` **ToolBar.ComboBoxStyleKey**`}"/>`
A resource key that represents the default style for combo boxes on the toolbar.
Reads the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.IsOverflowItem"></xref> property from the specified element.
The element from which to read the property.
The value of the property.
Reads the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.OverflowMode"></xref> property from the specified element.
For the possible mode values, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.OverflowMode>.
The element from which to read the property.
The value of the property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the toolbar has items that are not visible.
If a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> has more items than it has the space to show, it puts the remaining items in its overflow area.
The user can click the arrow on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> to access the overflow items.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if there are items on the toolbar that are not visible; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.HasOverflowItems"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.IsOverflowItem"></xref> attached property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref> overflow area is currently visible.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
`true` if the overflow area is visible; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.IsOverflowOpen"></xref> dependency property.
Remeasures a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
The measurement constraints.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref> cannot return a size larger than the constraint.
The size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> applied to menus on a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
Use this property to change the default style of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu> controls on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*="`{` **ToolBar.MenuStyleKey**`}"/>`
A resource key that represents the default style for menus on the toolbar.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ToolBarAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> property changes.
The arguments for the <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged"></xref> event.

Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event that occurs when a key is pressed on an item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
When the user presses HOME, the first item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> receives keyboard focus.
When the user presses END, the last item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> receives keyboard focus.

When this occurs, this implementation marks the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown> event as handled by setting the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property of the event data to `true`.
The arguments for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> event.

Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.LostMouseCapture"></xref> routed event that occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref> loses mouse capture.
This implementation does not change the handled state (the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property) of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LostMouseCapture> event data.
The arguments for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.LostMouseCapture"></xref> event.
Gets the orientation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
This property gets its value from the parent <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBarTray>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The toolbar orientation.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Orientation.Horizontal"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Orientation"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.OverflowMode"></xref> attached property.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
The element that will display the item.
The item to display.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> applied to radio buttons on a toolbar.
Use this property to change the default style of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RadioButton> controls on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*="`{` **ToolBar.RadioButtonStyleKey**`}"/>`
A resource key that represents the default style for radio buttons on the toolbar.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> applied to separators on a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
Use this property to change the default style of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator> controls on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*="`{` **ToolBar.SeparatorStyleKey**`}"/>`
A resource key that represents the default style for separators on the toolbar.
Writes the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar.OverflowMode"></xref> property to the specified element.
For the possible mode values, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.OverflowMode>.
The element to write the property to.
The property value to set.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> applied to text boxes on a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
Use this property to change the default style of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox> controls on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*="`{` **ToolBar.TextBoxStyleKey**`}"/>`
A resource key that represents the default style for text boxes on the toolbar
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> applied to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton"></xref> controls on a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar"></xref>.
Use this property to change the default style of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToggleButton> controls on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>.
XAML Attribute Usage
<*object* *property*="`{` **ToolBar.ToggleButtonStyleKey**`}"/>`
A resource key that represents the default style for toggle buttons on the toolbar.
